content: long tail from your cast on thread your darning needle and pick up the loops along your casting edge pull your pumpkin closed but be careful not to pull too tight this is where you ll be adding in your stalk if you ve already got your stick twig or cinnamon ready make sure your stick fits in the little hole at the top before weaving in your end time to pick a stalk finishing lumpy once our stalk/stick is in place its time to turn this carriage into a pumpkin using the long tail now at the bottom of the pumpkin wrap the tail up the side of the pumpkin following a vertical row of stitches and insert your needle at the base of your stalk push your needle down the center of the pumpkin and through the bottom of the pumpkin pull tightly to hide the tail and to encourage a cute dip at the top and bottom of your pumpkin do this 5 more times around the pumpkin until you have 5 sections you can always make more sections six or even 8 sections would make an adorable pumpkin or squash have fun with it personally i like my pumpkins and squash to look uneven and lumpy so i don t bother with shaping too much i love the natural imperfections now all that s left is to weave in your ends and voila 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 6 lumpy fingering weight for a fingering weight version of lumpy like this one - us 1 needles - fingering weight yarn 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 7 cast on 60 sts or any multiple of 6 using fingering weight yarn leave yourself a longer tail you ll use this to close your pumpkin at the end join in the round being careful not to twist your cast on edge - rnds 1-48 knit all stitches decrease row - round 1 *k5 k2tog* until the end - round 2 k2tog until the end - round 3 k2tog until the end finishing lumpy finish off your pumpkin in the same way you d finish off the bulky version using the long tail now at the bottom of the pumpkin wrap the tail up the side of the pumpkin following a vertical row of stitches and insert your needle at the base of your stalk push your needle down the center of the pumpkin and through the bottom of the pumpkin pull tightly to hide the tail and to encourage a cute dip at the top and bottom of your pumpkin do this 5 more times around the pumpkin until you have 5 sections what s so nice about these pumpkins you can really customize it any way you want fingering weight dk aran… it all works and that s it if you have any questions feel free to send me an email at hawaribazaar@gmail com i hope you enjoy knitting your pumpkins and don t
